io.straas.android.sdk.media

Class LiveEventListener

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.straas.android.sdk.media.LiveEventListener

  • public class LiveEventListener
extends Object
    This is for developer to listen live event state changes, you should call initWithLiveId(Identity, EventListener) to get the instance. Call start(String) to start observing changes and stop() to stop observing. You could observe the properties change like getBroadcastStateV2(), getBroadcastStartTimeInMS(), getCCU(), and getHitCount().

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  LiveEventListener.EventListener
      The listener to listen events sent by LiveEventListener.
      static interface  LiveEventListener.State
      The state of LiveEventListener, may be STATE_IDLE, STATE_STARTING, or STATE_STARTED.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int BROADCAST_STATE_DVR_PLAYBACK_AVAILABLE
      Means the live event state is still available for playback within amount of time temporarily when this event is not broadcasting for live dvr enabled live event.
      static int BROADCAST_STATE_ENDED
      Means the live event state is ended.
      static int BROADCAST_STATE_STARTED
      Means the live event is broadcasting.
      static int BROADCAST_STATE_STOPPED
      Means the live event is not broadcasting and state is not ended.
      static int BROADCAST_STATE_UNKNOWN
      The initial value before fetching any information about the live event.
      static int BROADCAST_STATE_WAITING_FOR_STREAM
      Means the live event is waiting for stream.
      static int STATE_IDLE
      Means the LiveEventListener is idle.
      static int STATE_STARTED
      Means the LiveEventListener has started.
      static int STATE_STARTING
      Means the LiveEventListener is starting.

    • Field Detail

      • STATE_IDLE

        public static final int STATE_IDLE
        Means the LiveEventListener is idle. In this state, you could call start(String) to listen live event state.
        See Also:
        getState(), Constant Field Values

      • STATE_STARTING

        public static final int STATE_STARTING
        Means the LiveEventListener is starting. In this state, you could wait for the result of start(String) or call stop() to stop it.
        See Also:
        getState(), Constant Field Values

      • STATE_STARTED

        public static final int STATE_STARTED
        Means the LiveEventListener has started. In this state, you could observe values change or call stop() if you don't want to observe anymore.
        See Also:
        getState(), Constant Field Values

      • BROADCAST_STATE_UNKNOWN

        public static final int BROADCAST_STATE_UNKNOWN
        The initial value before fetching any information about the live event.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • BROADCAST_STATE_STARTED

        public static final int BROADCAST_STATE_STARTED
        Means the live event is broadcasting.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • BROADCAST_STATE_STOPPED

        public static final int BROADCAST_STATE_STOPPED
        Means the live event is not broadcasting and state is not ended.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • BROADCAST_STATE_WAITING_FOR_STREAM

        public static final int BROADCAST_STATE_WAITING_FOR_STREAM
        Means the live event is waiting for stream. May caused when network issues happen on broadcaster or server side.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • BROADCAST_STATE_ENDED

        public static final int BROADCAST_STATE_ENDED
        Means the live event state is ended.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • BROADCAST_STATE_DVR_PLAYBACK_AVAILABLE

        public static final int BROADCAST_STATE_DVR_PLAYBACK_AVAILABLE
        Means the live event state is still available for playback within amount of time temporarily when this event is not broadcasting for live dvr enabled live event.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • initWithLiveId

        public static com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<LiveEventListener> initWithLiveId(Identity identity,
                                                                                  LiveEventListener.EventListener listener)
        Constructs a LiveEventListener if you are a authorized developer.
        Parameters:
        identity - The user who fetches the live event information.
        listener - The listener to listen events sent from LiveEventListener.

      • start

        public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Void> start(String liveId)
        Starts to listen the change of the live event related properties.

        You could only call this method when state is STATE_IDLE.
        Parameters:
        liveId - the live event id
        Returns:
        the start result

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops listening the live event related properties change.

        You could call this method in any state.

      • getState

        public int getState()
        Gets the state of LiveEventListener.
        Returns:
        the state of LiveEventListener
        See Also:
        STATE_IDLE, STATE_STARTING, STATE_STARTED

      • getLiveId

        public String getLiveId()
        Gets the id of current listening live event.
        Returns:
        live event id

      • getBroadcastStateV2

        public androidx.lifecycle.LiveData<Integer> getBroadcastStateV2()
        Gets the broadcastStateV2.

        The broadcastStateV2 may be BROADCAST_STATE_UNKNOWN, BROADCAST_STATE_STARTED, BROADCAST_STATE_STOPPED, BROADCAST_STATE_WAITING_FOR_STREAM, BROADCAST_STATE_ENDED or BROADCAST_STATE_DVR_PLAYBACK_AVAILABLE.
        Returns:
        the LiveData of broadcastStateV2
        See Also:
        BROADCAST_STATE_UNKNOWN, BROADCAST_STATE_STARTED, BROADCAST_STATE_STOPPED, BROADCAST_STATE_WAITING_FOR_STREAM, BROADCAST_STATE_ENDED, BROADCAST_STATE_DVR_PLAYBACK_AVAILABLE

      • getBroadcastStartTimeInMS

        public androidx.lifecycle.LiveData<Long> getBroadcastStartTimeInMS()
        Gets the broadcast start time of the live event.

        The value is the unix time in milliseconds and the initial value is null.
        Returns:
        the LiveData of broadcast start time

      • getCCU

        public androidx.lifecycle.LiveData<Integer> getCCU()
        Gets the CCU of the live event.

        The initial value is null.
        Returns:
        the LiveData of CCU
        See Also:
        doc

      • getHitCount

        public androidx.lifecycle.LiveData<Integer> getHitCount()
        Gets the hit count of the live event.

        The initial value is null.
        Returns:
        the LiveData of hit count
        See Also:
        doc
